_source.description: Nine 3-storey terrace houses with integral garages.

Demolition of the former cinema and single storey retail
unit to provide a three to eight storey building comprising
a neighbourhood retail store and 51 residential units
together with associated basement car parking and servicing
areas.
As shown on drawing numbers:  3865/ TA (20) P-1, P00,P00T,
P01A, P02A, P03, P04A, P05A, P06A, P07A, P08, E01, E02, E04,
E05, S01,S02.

The erection of an eight-storey building, plus basement, on the site of Nos. 40-50 Tottenham Street and 20-22 Tottenham Mews, St. Pancras, for use by the Department of Physical Medicine and the School of Physiotherapy of the Middlesex Hospital.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - (1) That the car-park shown on the submitted plans as 'Future Car-Park' shall be brought into use for car-parking purposes by the time the building is complete and such space shall be retained permanently for the accommodation of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the building only and not for any other purpose.
Condition : 2 - (2) That provision shall be made for the loading or unloading of vehicles, including ambulances, within the curtilage of the building.
Condition : 3 - (3) That details of the provision to made under Condition (2) above shall be submitted to and approved by the Council before any building work is commenced on the site.
Condition : 4 - (4) That details of the facing materials to be used shall be submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced.

_source.description: Alterations, extensions and conversion to 2 maisonettes at 63 Albert Street, Camden

The redevelopment of that part of the site by the
erection of 61 residential units comprising twenty-five
1-bedroom flats  twenty  2-bedroom units and sixteen
3-bedroom houses together with the use of the southern
part of the site for commercial purposes  as shown on
drawing nos. SG.CR 100B  101B  102B  103A  104B  105D
106C  107B  108B  109B  110A  111A  112A  113A  114A
115A  117  118  119  120C  121.1A  121.2  122A  123  124
revised on 25.04.94 and 12.05.94.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The facing materials to be used on the buildings shall not
    be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and
    approved by the Council before any work on the site is
    commenced.

Condition : 2 - All new works to and works of making good to the existing
    boundary walls shall be carried out to match the original
    work as closely as possible in materials and detailed
    execution.

Condition : 3 - No pipes or plumbing, other than rainwater pipes, shall be
    fixed on the external face of the building.

Condition : 4 - The whole of the car parking accommodation shown on the
    drawings shall be provided and retained permanently for the
    parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the
    remainder of the building.

Condition : 5 - No development shall take place until full details of hard
    and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all unbuilt,
    open areas have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council.

Condition : 6 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to
    the end of the following planting season, with others of
    similar size and species, unless the Council gives written
    consent to any variation.
    a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved
    landscape details, prior to the occupation for the
    permitted use of the development or any phase of the
    development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of
    planting which, within a period of 5 years from the
    completion of the development die, are removed, or become
    seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as
    is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than

Condition : 7 - The details of the means of enclosure of the proposed roof
    terraces shall not be otherwise than as shall have been
    submitted to and approved by the Council before any work on
    the site is begun.

Condition : 8 - Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and
    Country Planning General Development Order 1988 (as
    amended) or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order,
    no development within Part 1 (Classes A to H) and Part 2
    (Classes A to C) of Schedule 2 of that Order shall be
    carried out without the grant of planning permission having
    first been obtained from the Council.

Condition : 9 - To ensure that the external appearance of the building will
    be satisfactory.
Condition : 10 - To safeguard the special character of the building.

Condition : 11 - Because it is considered that these would seriously detract
    from the appearance of the building.

Condition : 12 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion.

Condition : 13 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 14 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard
    of visual amenity in the scheme.

Condition : 15 - To ensure that the proposal does not result in loss of
    amenity to existing residents by way of everlooking.

Condition : 16 - To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to
    prevent over-development of the site by controlling
    proposed extensions and alterations.

Condition : 17 - The Council's Engineering Services should be consulted
    regarding the construction of the crossover on the public
    highway and any other work to, under, or over the public
    highway, including vaults and thresholds. The Section
    dealing with these matters is located at Camden Town Hall,
    Argyle Street entrance, Euston Road, WC1H 8EQ (071-278
    4444).

Condition : 18 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not
    take place other than between the hours of 8am to 6pm on
    Monday to Friday and 8am to 1pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.

Condition : 19 - Noise from demolition and construction works is subject to
    control under The Control of Pollution Act 1974. You are
    advised to consult the Council's Planning, Transport &
    Health Service, Pollution Team, Town Hall, Argyle Street
    entrance, Euston Road, WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 071-278 4444), or to
    seek prior approval under Section 61 if you anticipate any
    difficulty in carrying out construction other than within
    normal working hours and by means that would minimise
    disturbance to adjoining premises.

Condition : 20 - In good time prior to the start of construction (or, if

_source.description:
Amendments to planning permission (ref. PE9800576R2) dated
26th April 2001 comprising the relocation of various
approved uses involving the transfer of Class A3 use at
first floor in the Horse Hospital and northern end of
Building A to the first floor of Building C, the transfer of
approved B1 accommodation from Building C to Building A and
the switching of the approved Class A1 and A3 uses between
the ground and first floors within the Long Stable building.
as shown on drawing numbers: 302E, 305E, 305F, 309E, 314E,
401E, 402E, 402F, 409E, 600A; D0401-8, D0401-9, C3101-1
(Building 3 Sections, Horse Hospital Section (3 drawings),
Horse Hospital Floor Plans (2 drawings) .

Amendment to planning permission (2003/1573/P) for the demolition of existing building and the erection of a 4-storey building to provide offices (class B1) on the ground floor with 8 residential units above.   The amendments involves the change of use of the B1(office) space at ground floor to C3 (residential) use as 2 x 1 bedroom and 1 x 3 bedroom flats.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

_source.description: Conversion of 46 Highgate West Hill into two maisonettes, the conversion of a former school building adjoining that property into a dwellinghouse and the erection on land at the rear of 3 garages and a dwellinghouse.
Change of use of ground, first, second, third and fourth floors from office use (B1) to residential to form 14 self-contained flats.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - The cycle parking space within the proposed building as shown on the drawings hereby approved shall be provided before the approved flats are occupied and shall be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure the flats have adequate cycle parking spaces and in order to meet the requirements of policy TR22 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - The use of the rear first floor flat roof as a terrace shall not commence until the privacy screening, as shown on the approved drawings, has been constructed. The screen shall be permanently retained and maintained thereafter. 

Reason: In order to prevent unreasonable overlooking of neighbouring premises in accordance with the requirements of policies S1/S2 and SD6 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 3 - All new external work shall be carried out in materials that resemble, as closely as possible, in colour and texture those of the existing building, unless otherwise specified in the approved application.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies S1/S2, B1 and B3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
_source.description: Replacement of first floor window on rear elevation with french doors and installation of railings and obscure glazed screens to rear first floor level flat roof all in connection with its use as a terrace.
Erection of a replacement double-height conservatory at rear basement and ground floor levels of the existing dwellinghouse, together with a replacement staircase to ground floor level.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - All new external work shall be carried out in materials that resemble, as closely as possible, in colour and texture those of the existing building, unless otherwise specified in the approved application.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policies S1, S2, B1, B7 of the Revised Deposit Draft as amended by the Proposed Modifications agreed by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006.

_source.description: Addition of a second storey above existing roofline, insertion of a flank window at first and second floor levels, insertion of 2 rooflights to front roofslope, erection of a dormer extension in rear roofslope created, erection of a single storey rear extension and erection of a glazed lean-to to side of dwellinghouse.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - All new external work, to include stonework, brick bond and pointing, shall be carried out in materials that resemble, as closely as possible, in colour and texture those of the existing building, unless otherwise specified in the approved application.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 3 - Where slate is annotated on the approved drawings, natural slate shall be used.

Reason: To safeguard the special character of the building and the Conservation Area in accordance with the requirements of policy EN31 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 2000.

Condition : 4 - Before the use of the glazed side extension hereby approved, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority, to demonstrate how excessive light spillage and overlooking from the premises will be avoided. Works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason:To safeguard the residential amenity of the occupiers at number 49 Roderick Road in accordance with the requirements of policy EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 2000.

Condition : 5 - The rooflight in the flat roof of the single storey rear extension hereby approved, shall contain only obscure glazing and be repaired and retained as such.

Reason:To safeguard the residential amenity of nearby occupiers in accordance with the requirements of policy EN19 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 2000.

_source.description: Change of use of 2 self-contained maisonettes [1 x 3-bed and 1 x 4-bed] on the first and second floor to 5 self-contained flats [1 x 2-bed flat, 2 x 1-bed flats and 2 x studio flats] including the use of an existing garage as a bike, refuse and recycling store.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - Before the development commences, details of the proposed cycle storage area for 5 cycles shall be submitted to and approved by the Council. The approved facility shall thereafter be provided in its entirety prior to the first occupation of any of the new units, and thereafter permanently maintained and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the development provides adequate cycle parking facilities in accordance with the requirements of policy T3 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 3 - Before the development commences, details of the location, design and method of waste storage and removal (including recycled materials) shall be submitted to and approved by the Council.  The approved facilty shall be provided in its entirety prior to the first occupation of any of the new residential units and permanently maintained and retained thereafter.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy SD6 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.

_source.description: Retrospective change of use from retail (Class A1) to cafe (Class A3).
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
Condition : 2 - No customers shall be on the premises in connection with the use at the following times, between 16.00 hours and 08.00 hours the following day.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 and SH18 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 3 - Rubbish shall not be placed on the highway until 1 hour prior to refuse collection.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 and SH18  of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

_source.description: The display of 2x internally illuminated (LED foil) signs on the front elevation 1st to 4th floor levels.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - This consent shall operate for a period of five years from the date of this decision letter.

Reason: In order to comply with Regulation 13(5) of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisement) Regulations 1992.
Condition : 2 - Any advertisements displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a clean and tidy condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the Council.

Reason: As required by Regulation 13(1)(a) and Schedule 1 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) Regulations 1992 and to safeguard amenity and safety in the area.
Condition : 3 - Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a safe condition.

Reason: As required by Regulation 13(1)(a) and Schedule 1 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) Regulations 1992 and to safeguard amenity and safety in the area.
Condition : 4 - Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the removal shall be carried out to the reasonable satisfaction of the Council. 

Reason: As required by Regulation 13(1)(a) and Schedule 1 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) Regulations 1992 and to safeguard amenity and safety in the area.
Condition : 5 - No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

Reason: As required by Regulation 13(1)(a) and Schedule 1 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) Regulations 1992 and to safeguard amenity and safety in the area.
Condition : 6 - No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to obscure or hinder the ready interpretation of any road traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or so as otherwise to render hazardous the use of any highway, railway or waterway.

Reason: As required by Regulation 13(1)(a) and Schedule 1 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) Regulations 1992 and to safeguard amenity and safety in the area.
Condition : 7 - The hereby approved signage shall not be erected before the existing banner and two flagpoles are removed permanentely from the front of the building.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN30 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 and policy B4 of the Proposed Modifications to the Revised Deposit Draft [as approved by the Council's Executive on 11th January 2006].
